title: Filipa Patão shared her thoughts on becoming the inaugural head coach of Boston Legacy FC
author: Hayden Bird
bullets: Filipa Patão appointed inaugural head coach of Boston Legacy FC, previously led Benfica to five consecutive Portuguese league titles.
Patão embraces the challenge of the competitive NWSL with Legacy FC, aligning with former Barcelona executive Domènec Guasch on team vision.

title: Jeremy Swayman feels like a ‘completely different human being’ a year removed from contract dispute
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Jeremy Swayman signed an eight-year, $66 million contract with the Bruins, resolving past contract disputes.
Swayman improved his offseason training and helped Team USA win gold, boosting his confidence for the new NHL season.

title: What Josh McDaniels said about facing the Raiders
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Josh McDaniels, Patriots offensive coordinator, will face his former team, the Raiders, in Sunday's home opener.
McDaniels reflects on lessons learned from his 9-16 record as Raiders head coach and expresses no ill will towards them.

title: Elizabeth Banks cast as Karen Read: What readers said about the limited series role
author: Frances Klemm
bullets: Elizabeth Banks will star and executive produce a Prime Video series on Karen Read's murder case, sparking mixed reader reactions.
The series, based on the podcast 'Karen,' explores true crime fascination; Read is uninvolved and expressed disapproval of the project.

title: 2 New England casinos just ranked the best in the U.S. (that aren’t in Las Vegas)
author: Kristi Palma
bullets: Mohegan Sun in Uncasville, Conn., ranked No. 2 and Foxwoods Resort Casino in Mashantucket, Conn., ranked No. 3 in USA Today's 2025 best non-Vegas casinos list.
Mohegan Sun offers two casinos and traditional Asian games; Foxwoods has five casinos and the largest poker room on the East Coast.

title: What to know about Seisiún, the two-day Irish music festival coming to Boston
author: Kevin Slane
bullets: Seisiún, a two-day Irish music festival in Boston, features Dropkick Murphys and The Pogues, their first US show in 20 years.
Held at Suffolk Downs, the festival includes performances by The Hold Steady, The Waterboys, and Glen Hansard among others.

title: CommonWealth Kitchen staff, members speak out over toxic nonprofit: Globe report
author: Katelyn Umholtz
bullets: CommonWealth Kitchen accused of toxic environment by staff, members; alleges lack of promised support and improper conduct by leadership.
Board supports Executive Director Jen Faigel amidst criticism, pledges to address issues and maintain CWK's mission of inclusive entrepreneurship.

title: 44 proposed Mass. ballot questions, including rent control, move to next step — and 3 don’t make the cut
author: Madison Lucchesi
bullets: 44 ballot initiatives advance to the next stage in Massachusetts, while 3 were rejected, as announced by Attorney General Andrea Campbell.
Proposals include rent control, tax reductions, and same-day voter registration, requiring signature collection to possibly appear on future ballots.

title: RFK Jr. tries to defend COVID vaccine stance in raucous Senate hearing
author: The Associated Press
bullets: RFK Jr. faced bipartisan criticism at a Senate hearing over his COVID vaccine stance, including firing the CDC director and vaccine advisory panel changes.
Democratic and Republican senators expressed concerns about RFK Jr.'s COVID policy shifts; medical groups called for his removal.

title: Juvenile with ‘airsoft replica weapon’ determined to have caused UMass Lowell lockdown
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: A juvenile with an airsoft gun caused a three-hour lockdown at UMass Lowell, involving a major police response.
No shots were fired or injuries reported; classes resumed Thursday at UMass Lowell with mental health resources offered.
